cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the southern Gulf, then turning north toward the Louisiana Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely between Cameron and Vermilion Bay)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas through Louisiana to Mississippi/Alabama barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (up to 50–60 mph) with a moderate (37%) chance of 50-kt gusts and a smaller (18%) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor river surge/backwater possible on the Lower Mississippi but significant coastal surge will remain south of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause urban and river flooding around Baton Rouge.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential power outages, fallen trees, and temporary navigation restrictions on the Mississippi River due to high wind and heavy rainfall.
